net.sourceforge.prowl.api
Interface ProwlEvent

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultProwlEvent
public interface ProwlEvent

Author:
Christian Ternes

This interface specifies the methods that are needed to communicate with the Prowl application

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getApiKey()
          Retrieves your Prowl device api key.
 java.lang.String getApplication()
          Retrieves the application which is the source for this event.
 java.lang.String getDescription()
          Retrieves the description of the prowl event.
 java.lang.String getEvent()
          Retrieves the event name of the prowl event.
 int getPriority()
          Retrieves the priority of the prowl event.
 void setApiKey(java.lang.String apiKey)
          Sets the Prowl api key for your device.
 void setApplication(java.lang.String application)
          Sets the name of the application part of the prowl event
 void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
          Sets the description of the prowl event.

          Sets the event name of the prowl event.

          Sets the priority of the Prowl event.
 

Method Detail

setApiKey

void setApiKey(java.lang.String apiKey)
Sets the Prowl api key for your device.

Parameters:
apiKey - your device api key

getApiKey

java.lang.String getApiKey()
Retrieves your Prowl device api key.

Returns:
your device api key

setPriority

void setPriority(int prio)
Sets the priority of the Prowl event. The following range is supported: -2: Very Low -1: Moderate 0: Normal 1: High 2: Emergency.

Parameters:
prio - the event priority

getPriority

int getPriority()
Retrieves the priority of the prowl event.

Returns:
the event priority

setApplication

void setApplication(java.lang.String application)
Sets the name of the application part of the prowl event

Parameters:
application - the application from which comes the event

getApplication

java.lang.String getApplication()
Retrieves the application which is the source for this event.

Returns:
the source application

setEvent

void setEvent(java.lang.String event)
Sets the event name of the prowl event. This should be the action provided by this event. E.g. TwitterNotification

Parameters:
event - the event name

getEvent

java.lang.String getEvent()
Retrieves the event name of the prowl event.

Returns:
the event name

setDescription

void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
Sets the description of the prowl event. This should be the detailed notification message.

Parameters:
description - the detailed message

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Retrieves the description of the prowl event.

Returns:
the description of the prowl event
